intro: Nabaluia, commonly known as the sacred tree of the indigenous people of the Philippines, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Nabaluia holds cultural and spiritual significance in local communities, often symbolizing protection and prosperity.
